response:
A slowly progressive picture with combined long-tract and ipsilateral cerebellar signs centred on the cervicomedullary junction strongly favours a structural compressive lesion, with demyelinating and vascular causes considered next based on age and potential for multifocal disease.

differential_diagnosis = ["Foramen magnum meningioma", "Chiari I malformation with cervicomedullary compression (with or without syringomyelia)", "Intradural extramedullary tumour at the cervicomedullary junction (e.g., nerve sheath tumour, meningeal metastasis)", "Intramedullary cervical spinal cord tumour at C1\u2013C2 (e.g., ependymoma or astrocytoma)", "Multiple sclerosis with plaque at the cervicomedullary junction and right cerebellar hemisphere", "Lateral medullary or posterior inferior cerebellar artery territory infarction", "Inflammatory myelitis of the upper cervical cord (e.g., neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder)"]
